alert.note: Alert for Blaine; Caddo; Dewey (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 01 at 7:21AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of north central Washita, northwestern Caddo, eastern Custer, southwestern Blaine and southeastern Dewey Counties through 800 AM CDT... At 721 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 3 miles northwest of Thomas to 6 miles northwest of Corn. Movement was northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Weatherford, Watonga, Thomas, Hydro, Custer City, Fay and Eagle City. This includes Interstate 40 between mile markers 70 and 95. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
